title: ERROR mlflow.cli: Could not find main among entry points [] or interpret main as a runnable script.
body:
### Problem description - 
I am trying run my project using MLflow Project. I have created Conda.yaml file for env specs and MLproject.yaml file for run specs. Along with supportive config file required as an argument, all the files are placed in the project directory. When I cd to the project location and run "mlflow run . --no-conda" I receive the output as below.

2020/12/16 19:49:17 ERROR mlflow.cli: === Could not find main among entry points [] or interpret main as a runnable script. Supported script file extensions: ['.py', '.sh'] === 

### System specifications - 
Entry point - (Custom code) train.py contains main function.
OS platform - Mac OS (macOS-10.15.7-x86_64-i386-64bit)
MLflow installation source - pip3
MLflow version - 1.12.1
Python version - 3.9.0
Command to reproduce issue - (cd to project directory) Run "mlflow run . --no-conda" 

Note - I am not using any Conda env to. run this. Just to give a try, I tried to run the same within Conda env (both base and another customised one satisfying requirements of the project). Every time I faced the same error. 

### File specs - 
**conda.yaml -**
name: yolo_env
channels:
  - anaconda
  - conda-forge
  - defaults
dependencies:
  - awscli=1.18.191
  - boto3=1.16.31
  - cython=0.29.21
  - dvc=0.54.1
  - DateTime=4.3
  - imgaug=0.4.0
  - keras=2.2.5
  - matplotlib=2.2.5
  - mlflow=1.12.1
  - numpy=1.19.2
  - opencv=3.4.2
  - pandas=1.1.3
  - pillow=8.0.0
  - pycocotools=2.0.2
  - python=3.7.9
  - seaborn=0.11.0
  - slackclient=2.9.3
  - tensorflow=1.14.0
prefix: /Users/shrutid/opt/anaconda3/envs/yolo_env

**MLproject.yamp -**
name: Project1

conda_env: complete_project_path_from_root/conda.yaml

entry_points:
  main:
    parameters:
      config_file: complete_project_path_from_root/config.json
    command: "python3 complete_project_path_from_root/train.py -c {config_file}"

What am I missing?
